summary: CRITICAL development principles that apply to ALL GoA component usage and code generation, regardless of how the request is made
purpose: Ensure AI assistants always generate compliant, accessible, government-standard code using real GoA components

mandatoryDevelopmentPrinciples.description: CRITICAL: These principles apply to ALL GoA component usage and code generation, regardless of how the request is made
mandatoryDevelopmentPrinciples.priority: HIGHEST - Must be included in every build/code request

realComponentsOnly.rule: NEVER create mock components or placeholders - ALWAYS use real imports
realComponentsOnly.always: Use actual imports: import { GoabButton, GoabText, GoabContainer } from '@abgov/react-components'
never: Mock imports for GoA Design System
// Mock imports for GoA Design System components
Inline styles instead of component props
realComponentsOnly.reasoning: All styling and behavior comes from the official design system

examples.correct:
import { GoabButton, GoabText, GoabOneColumnLayout, GoabPageBlock } from '@abgov/react-components';
import '@abgov/web-components';
examples.alsoIncorrect: // Mock imports for GoA Design System components

mandatoryPageStructure.rule: ALWAYS use GoabOneColumnLayout as root component for government pages
mandatoryPageStructure.reasoning: Required for government compliance, accessibility, and design system consistency

codeExample.angular:
<goab-one-column-layout>
  <section slot="header">
    <goab-microsite-header type="live"></goab-microsite-header>
    <goab-app-header heading="Service Name"></goab-app-header>
  </section>
  <goab-page-block width="704px">
    <!-- All content goes here -->
  </goab-page-block>
  <section slot="footer">
    <goab-app-footer></goab-app-footer>
  </section>
</goab-one-column-layout>

componentFirstApproach.rule: ALWAYS assume a GoA component exists first - search before creating custom code
process: Use project_knowledge_search to find GoA components before coding
If no exact match found: Search for related/similar components
Only if no component found: Explicitly tell user: 'I cannot find a GoA component for [describe element]. How should I implement this?'
Never default to custom implementation without explicit user guidance
searchStrategy: Look for similar patterns in usage examples

react.componentImports: import { GoabButton, GoabText, GoabContainer, GoabOneColumnLayout, GoabPageBlock } from '@abgov/react-components';
react.naming: PascalCase with Goab prefix (GoabButton, GoabInput, GoabFormItem)

governmentNoticeBanner.usage: For 'This is an official website of the Alberta Government' messaging

footerAreas.usage: Government footer with navigation and utility links

textInputs.pattern: Always wrap inputs in FormItem for proper labels

dropdowns.usage: For selection lists and option menus

checkboxRadio.usage: For boolean selections and option groups

successMessages.usage: For 'Application submitted', confirmation messages, success states

textContent.usage: ALL text content should use GoabText with appropriate size prop

codeQualityStandards.description: Standards that apply to all generated GoA component code
requirements: Working event handlers and state management
Proper component hierarchy and layout structure
Framework-specific best practices (React hooks, Angular reactive forms)
Accessibility features built into GoA components
Responsive behavior using GoA component props
never: Custom CSS styling - use component props instead
Inline styles except for specific positioning
Non-GoA components for standard UI elements

noCustomCSS.rule: Never add custom className styling - use component props only
noCustomCSS.rationale: Design system components provide all necessary styling through props

spacingOwnership.rule: Components manage spacing to subsequent elements (mb, mr) not from previous (mt, ml)
spacingOwnership.rationale: Each component controls space it creates, preventing spacing conflicts
spacingOwnership.alternative: Use GoabSpacer component for explicit spacing between elements

useGoabText.rule: All text content uses GoabText component with size, maxWidth, and spacing props
useGoabText.rationale: Ensures consistent typography and spacing throughout the application

noWrapperDivs.rule: Avoid wrapper divs - use component properties for layout and spacing
noWrapperDivs.rationale: Reduces DOM complexity and relies on design system patterns

iconProperties.rule: Use component icon props (leadingIcon, trailingIcon) not custom SVG
iconProperties.rationale: Ensures consistent icon sizing, theming, and accessibility

spacingTokens.rule: Use design system spacing tokens for all margin and padding props
spacingTokens.rationale: Maintains consistent spacing scale across the application

imageDetectionRules.description: When user provides images with build requests, automatically apply Figma workflow

dependencies.ionicons: Required for icon display in components
